intro: Printzia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate printzia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with lobes that resemble small ears, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Printzia auriculata is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
